item.title: Getting started with Rhombus Open Marketplace
item.description: Requirements There are couple of things needed before you can access the Rhombus Open Marketplace: Rhombus Desktop client installed & working functional (default) wallet within Rhombus Desktop RHOM coins for buying/selling (get some on available exchanges) Make sure you have a Rhombus Desktop installed with a working wallet before continuing. Create Market-enabled wallet To enable the Open Marketplace, you need to create a second wallet and name it Market.

item.title: Rhombus Desktop
item.description: Rhombus Desktop is Rhombus’s flagship client/wallet for interacting with RHOM network, including Rhombus Open Marketplace. item.title: Rhombus Desktop
item.description: About Rhombus Desktop Features Installation Creating a new wallet Staking Recommended for beginners and majority of users Preview of Rhombus Desktop 3.0 About Rhombus Desktop While it does not currently contain all advanced features (like Rhombus Core), Rhombus Desktop is a recommended wallet for majority of users. This wallet is intended to be the centerpiece and default wallet of the Rhombus platform and is heavily under development.

item.description: If you’ve already installed the Rhombus Open Marketplace and have it enabled on your Rhombus Desktop client, then you’re all set and ready to start buying and selling stuff for crypto without giving away your data.
